sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Find the solution to the system of linear equations using QR decomposition method:
    
             x + 2y - z = 3
             2x + 3y + z = 7
             3x + 7y + 4z = 10
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using the QR decomposition method, we first need to rewrite the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

The given system can be written as:

A = | 1  2 -1 |    x = | x |    b = | 3 |
    | 2  3  1 |        | y |        | 7 |
    | 3  7  4 |        | z |        |10 |

Now, we will perform QR decomposition on matrix A. QR decomposition is a method of decomposing a matrix A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and the upper triangular matrix R.

1. Find the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = a1 = (1, 2, 3)
u2 = a2 - proj_u1(a2) = (2, 3, 7) - ((1, 2, 3)·(2, 3, 7))/||(1, 2, 3)||^2 * (1, 2, 3) = (2, 3, 7) - (29/14)(1, 2, 3) = (3/14, 1/14, 17/14)
u3 = a3 - proj_u1(a3) - proj_u2(a3) = (-1, 1, 4) - ((1, 2, 3)·(-1, 1, 4))/||(1, 2, 3)||^2 * (1, 2, 3) - ((3/14, 1/14, 17/14)·(-1, 1, 4))/||(3/14, 1/14, 17/14)||^2 * (3/14, 1/14, 17/14) = (-1, 1, 4) - (5/14)(1, 2, 3) - (1/2)(3/14, 1/14, 17/14) = (0, 0, 1)

2. Normalize the orthogonal basis to get the orthonormal basis:

q1 = u1/||u1|| = (1, 2, 3)/||(1, 2, 3)|| = (1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14)
q2 = u2/||u2|| = (3/14, 1/14, 17/14)/||(3/14, 1/14, 17/14)|| = (3/√170, 1/√170, 17/√170)
q3 = u3/||u3|| = (0, 0, 1)/||(0, 0, 1)|| = (0, 0, 1)

Now, we have the orthogonal matrix Q:

Q = | 1/√14  3/√170  0 |
    | 2/√14  1/√170  0 |
    | 3/√14 17/√170  1 |

Next, we find the upper triangular matrix R:

R = Q^T * A

R = | 1/√14  2/√14  3/√14 |  | 1  2 -1 |
    | 3/√170 1/√170 17/√170 |  | 2  3  1 |
    |   0      0      1    |  | 3  7  4 |

R = | √14  5/√14  5/√14 |
    |  0   3/√170  1/√170 |
    |  0     0       1   |

Now, we have the QR decomposition of A:

A = QR

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = | 1/√14  2/√14  3/√14 |  | 3 |
          | 3/√170 1/√170 17/√170 |  | 7 |
          |   0      0      1    |  |10 |

Q^T * b = | 14/√14 |
          |  3/√170 |
          |   10    |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^T * b:

| √14  5/√14  5/√14 | | x |   | 14/√14 |
|  0   3/√170  1/√170 | | y | = |  3/√170 |
|  0     0       1   | | z |   |   10    |

Solving this system, we get:

z = 10
y = (3/√170 - 10/√170) / (3/√170) = -7/3
x = (14/√14 - 5/√14 * (-7/3) - 5/√14 * 10) / √14 = 2

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 2
y = -7/3
z = 10
